title: Why does Riot have double standards for Lee Sin? Even implying that they KNOW he's broken.
body:
https://twitter.com/RiotMorello/status/484042166948212736 - Ryan Scot: " Actually, when we nerf Lee, it causes a HUGE uproar. If I wasn't worried about what people thought we'd nerf him months ago. "

Why nerf ANY champion since EVERY champion's fanbase will think lowly of their champion being nerfed. This reason seems completely retarded to me when you're trying to decide whether or not to balance a game. Why the double standard with Lee? Why only think of the backlash from his fanbase instead of taking into the consideration of the rest of the community who have to put up with Lee?

replies.body: I wish they would realise that Lee Sin's fanbase is not bigger than the number of people who are sick of him.
Yea, I always see these threads complaining about Lee, but I haven't seen this so called backlash from the community about gutting him

Well yeah, thats just human psychology. If a person is fine with Lee, they have no real reason to make threads or comments saying "He's fine." On the other hand, if a person hates Lee, they have every reason to be expressive about it. Hence the term "vocal minority." Or I think thats the term. Whatever, you get the main point.

The last time I remember Lee getting a nerf, there was a blip of complaints for like half a day, where there are popular threads complaining about Lee on Boards pretty much every single day. I was going off MotherTeresa1910's point that Morello seems to think that the whole LoL community will turn against them if they nerf/rework Lee Sin into something that's not as dominant, where honestly it looks like there's actually substantially more support for it than opposition.

> where honestly **it looks like **there's actually substantially more support for it than opposition.

And thats the point I'm trying to get it. Its impossible for us to know if there is in fact more or less support. There are a lot of complainers, but that doesn't say anything about people who are fine with it. It just means a lot of people complain. 
Also, the last time Riot tried to go near Lee for his 'rework, the backlash was...considerable. I mean, DAMN. The reason why the complaints didn't last a long time was because the rework itself was quickly scrapped.

I've definitely heard rumors about that, never seen it for myself; [is this what you're talking about?](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback/jHhmhlGe-lets-talk-about-lee-sin-retune). Because after reading some Cassiopeia threads it doesn't seem that bad tbh. What I don't understand is that there's been backlash for like, half a year about the Cassiopeia rework, there's ongoing backlash about the constant Sona nerfs, etc. but that doesn't stop them from continuing anyways with the changes.

Honestly, the number of people who are fine with Lee as he is right now (I'm sort of one of them; I'd like to see more diversity at the professional level, but I think he does occasionally do some cool stuff even if most of it is pretty mundane at this point, and I don't care about Lee in my own games cause no one at my elo knows how to play him) is pretty much the same as the number of people who'd be fine with Lee if he got reworked.

The frustrating this is, sure, if they acknowledge that Lee is broken (which they have on several occasions), and they can't change him directly because they're afraid of the community, why not just boost everyone up to his level? But for some reason, other junglers that are competitors to him (Elise, Eve, Kha, Rengar) all seem to get nerfed, and none of the other junglers receive significant enough buffs to compete. They don't balance Lee to the game, and they don't balance the game around Lee

>I've definitely heard rumors about that, never seen it for myself; is this what you're talking about?. Because after reading some Cassiopeia threads it doesn't seem that bad tbh. What I don't understand is that there's been backlash for like, half a year about the Cassiopeia rework, there's ongoing backlash about the constant Sona nerfs, etc. but that doesn't stop them from continuing anyways with the changes.

You're thinking too close to home.

Riot has said that the chinese(I believe) community REALLY likes Lee, and they feel he does not deserve to be nerfed. So, while you may see all the feedback coming from NA and EU, (more likely you see a semi-random sample, but...) you see 0% of the feedback coming from non-english speaking players of LoL, who probably make up a bigger number of people than the english speaking players.

Fair enough, I guess inSec plays in China now (I think? I'm assuming he's still with SHRC), lol (I know it's not just inSec but yea)

I guess when I'm not QQing (for the record I don't really have a problem with Lee; no one can play him well at my elo and he does have some cool plays at the professional level. I just understand the sentiment a lot of NA/EU players have and sort of argue in favor of that) I don't think he should be nerfed, rather reworked; I more get the impression that Lee is going to get reworked anyways (a few Riot comments have hinted at that. I think the first rework had so much backlash since, from what I saw, they were really watering down his kit, instead of emphasizing what makes Lee Sin cool and de-emphasizing what he doesn't really need, like the spell-vamp or something)
So the lesson we can take away from this is that if they want to nerf a champion, and you make a big enough uproar, they'll stop.

He has the best mobility in the game, he has great stats and has great damage early game (falls off late game)
But for a jungler job it is to snowball your teams lane or get them ahead and with his insane early game damage he can do it easy.

The prime reason Lee Sin has to be nerfed is because he has been a dominating force since Season 1 he was released April 1st 2011.
And for him to still be a force to reckon with for over 4 years. Yes Lee Sin needs to get some nerfs so if you aren't a god Lee Sin you auto win the game.
